Many AI businesses are searching for moats. A data moat strengthens your defenses if the data is hard to replicate. But if a business offers direct access to a ML model's output (like many LLMs), competitors can use that output as labeled training data, circumventing the moat.While a data moat can be helpful, I find people tend to overestimate its strength. The engineering recipe of training on someone else’s API output also raises technical, business and legal questions. My longer piece on this in The Batch:

Vicuña features perhaps the most cost-effective approach to LLM, attaining 90+% of the quality of a full ChatGPT, with much less cost ($300!) and carbon footprint. Maybe a personalized LLM at your side assisting won’t be too far away?

La souveraineté économique de notre Europe.    C'est notre objectif. Pour l'atteindre, l'Europe a cessé d’être naïve. Elle peut désormais défendre ses intérêts, ses valeurs et son indépendance.  → La force de l’Europe est son marché unique. En innovant, en réformant, en renforçant nos systèmes éducatifs et la formation, en mobilisant plus efficacement les capitaux, nous poursuivons nos efforts pour faire émerger des acteurs forts, qui incarnent notre souveraineté.→ Faire progresser la politique industrielle européenne implique de mieux protéger nos entreprises. C'est le sens de notre stratégie de lutte contre les distorsions de concurrence, de réduction de nos dépendances stratégiques, et de protection de notre propriété intellectuelle.→ Le Net Zero Industry Act en simplifiant nos règles et procédures va nous permettre d’accélérer le développement de nos industries qui contribuent à la transition climatique.→ Secteur si essentiel pour nos industries, nos économies et nos sociétés, l'Europe se devait d’investir dans les semi-conducteurs du futur. Avec le Chips Act, nous restons dans la course.En France, nous allons doubler nos capacités de production d'ici 2030. Plus de 5000 emplois vont être créés !→ Avec les mesures miroirs, nous ferons en sorte que pour accéder au marché européen, les producteurs de pays tiers soient soumis aux mêmes règles de production que celles de notre Union. C’est essentiel, tant pour protéger les consommateurs européens par des normes fortes que nous nous imposons déjà à nous-mêmes, que pour nos entreprises face à une concurrence déloyale.→ Dans chaque négociation commerciale, nous devrons intégrer des critères de durabilité comme le respect de l’accord de Paris et la préservation de la biodiversité, d’équité, d’équilibre, de compatibilité avec nos intérêts stratégiques.C'est cohérent avec nos objectifs climatiques et nous en tirerons un bénéfice mutuel.Nous œuvrons à des conditions équitables de concurrence pour nos entreprises, au respect par les pays tiers de standards ambitieux et des valeurs universelles.Une Europe qui défend ses intérêts et ses valeurs, reste maîtresse de son destin, crée des emplois, mène à bien sa transition climatique, voilà ce que nous sommes en train de bâtir.

My point is: regulate the product offering (we do this for many things such as medicine, cigarettes, or weapons), but not the research, on LLM; and look beyond just language models, but also foundation models for biology, physics, climate, etc.. There are a lot more values to be unlocked, and a lot less to be feared for.

𝗟𝗶𝗸𝗲 𝗺𝗼𝘀𝘁 𝗽𝗲𝗼𝗽𝗹𝗲 𝗶𝗻 𝗺𝘆 𝗻𝗲𝘁𝘄𝗼𝗿𝗸, #𝗔𝗜 𝗵𝗮𝗽𝗽𝗲𝗻𝗲𝗱 𝗼𝘃𝗲𝗿𝗻𝗶𝗴𝗵𝘁 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗺𝗲. 𝗨𝗻𝗹𝗶𝗸𝗲 𝗺𝗼𝘀𝘁 𝗽𝗲𝗼𝗽𝗹𝗲 𝗶𝗻 𝗺𝘆 𝗻𝗲𝘁𝘄𝗼𝗿𝗸👇I'm a co-founder of Curiouser AI and have brilliant colleagues like Surbhi Gupta.  She's been in the #machinelearning and #NLP space for years and has deep expertise.So when she recommends I read or watch something, I listen. Which led me to this 32-minute conversation between Andrew Ng  and Yann LeCun: "𝐖𝐡𝐲 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝟔-𝐌𝐨𝐧𝐭𝐡 𝐀𝐈 𝐏𝐚𝐮𝐬𝐞 𝐢𝐬 𝐚 𝐁𝐚𝐝 𝐈𝐝𝐞𝐚."I'm not sure where I stand on the whole 𝗧𝗼 𝗣𝗮𝘂𝘀𝗲 𝗼𝗿 𝗡𝗼𝘁 𝘁𝗼 𝗣𝗮𝘂𝘀𝗲 𝗔𝗜 argument. It's a hypothetical conversation anyway. I'm a human being, which means I can hold competing thoughts in my head at the same time. 💡𝐌𝐚𝐲𝐛𝐞 𝐭𝐡𝐚𝐭'𝐬 𝐰𝐡𝐚𝐭 𝐦𝐚𝐤𝐞𝐬 𝐮𝐬 𝐬𝐨 𝐬𝐩𝐞𝐜𝐢𝐚𝐥 𝐚𝐟𝐭𝐞𝐫 𝐚𝐥𝐥!I think we need processing time to catch up...𝗔𝗡𝗗 I think that most of us have only started to explore and understand AI's potential, so why stop now? If you're like me before 2023, in a demanding corporate job, you haven't had time to learn about this. At least not the way you wish you could. I second Surbhi's recommendation that you watch this video (link in carousel). But in case you can't get to it, here are the key concepts and quotes from Yann LeCun that resonated with me. Let me know what you think in the comments. Especially if you find the time to watch the video. And if there are other long reads or views you've bookmarked that you're afraid you won't get to, share them with me. I'm happy to consume and summarize key takeaways for my busy network!

I attended Andrew Ng and Yann LeCun's talk on the 6-Month AI Pause last week.AI is on everyone's minds and how we can use future applications for business and sales.  Here are the takeaways shared during the talk if you didn't have time to attend:🔥 This proposal to halt research is not pragmatic or even implementable. 🔥 Concerns around ethics, safety, and bias are real, but research is helping these areas. 🔥 Why should we stop research and halt progress? Regulating products is better than halting research.  🔥 Research has improved AI immensely and has helped us resolve some of the biases.🔥 There is such hype around AI right now, but we are NOT that close to human-level intelligence in all the domains.  🔥 Language FLUENCY is NOT necessarily intelligence. 🔥 The panic towards the future is misguided.  🔥Remember Moravec's Paradox: things that appear to be sophisticated are often simple for machines (like chess), but things that appear simple for humans are often very difficult for machines. 🔥Remember that cars and aviation were once unsafe, and we regulated them and they have become safer and safer for the public. 🔥The proposal to halt research is not pragmatic or implementable.🔥Every time in history that there has been a major breakthrough, the knee-jerk reaction has been fear and trying to stop progress (the printing press, etc.). 🔥It is concerning that OpenAI pivoted from being an open for researchers and a non-profit to largely a lab for Microsoft, however the proposal is not to have OpenAI open up again. 🔥 AI escape is not a real risk because AI--unlike humans--does not have a motivation or drive.  🔥AI research can assist with regulations.🔥Also, AI has great promise and will amplify human intelligence.  🔥It is very possible that we will have another Renaissance or another Enlightenment due to AI breakthroughs. Share your thoughts below. 👇 If you would like to listen to the whole talk, I am including the link.   Dr. Andrew Ng an entrepreneur and founder of DeepLearning.AI, an AI and ML researcher, and is a professor at Stanford University. He was the cofounder of Google Brain and was the former Chief Scientist at Baidu, Inc.. Dr. Yan LeCun is a researcher and computer scientist who works in the areas of AI, ML, computational neuroscience, and robotics.  He received the 2018 Turing Award.  He has done research at AT&T Bell Labs and currently the Vice President and Chief AI Scientist at Facebook Meta. #ai #business #chatgpt #sales #technology #future #futurism #share #deeplearning

#MONDAY_MOTIVATION On m’a demandé quel serait le conseil que j’aurais donné à un entrepreneur sur la base de mon expérience personnelle ? Ce conseil qui ne s’applique pas qu’aux entrepreneurs d’ailleurs, je le tiens d’un ancien collègue Zimbabwéen qui m’a dit qu’il trouvait que l’environnement francophone était "beaucoup dans la rhétorique, dans la correction des fautes et dans l’hésitation". Pour lui, il fallait tester autant de fois que possible l’idée afin de « maitriser le process ».Pour avoir vécu dans des environnements francophones comme anglophones, il se dit adepte du « Fail-fast ». Il n’arrêtait d'ailleurs pas de répéter : « en documentant chaque échec, je peux remonter la pente en évitant cette erreur la prochaine fois et ainsi de suite ».  Aujourd’hui, il emploie +35 salariés à temps plein.  Son secret: "𝑟𝑒𝑝𝑒𝑎𝑡𝑒𝑑 𝑓𝑎𝑖𝑙𝑢𝑟𝑒 + 𝑖𝑛𝑡𝑟𝑜𝑠𝑝𝑒𝑐𝑡𝑖𝑜𝑛 + 𝑐𝑜𝑛𝑐𝑟𝑒𝑡𝑒 𝑚𝑒𝑎𝑠𝑢𝑟𝑒𝑠 𝑡𝑜 𝑎𝑑𝑑𝑟𝑒𝑠𝑠 𝑡ℎ𝑒 𝑝𝑟𝑜𝑏𝑙𝑒𝑚”. Comme toute théorie, cela n’est sans doute pas toujours vérifiable, mais de mon expérience, hésiter à lancer son projet n’est pas la meilleure des approches non plus car pour que cela marche, il faut bien commencer quelque part...𝑳’𝒊𝒏𝒅𝒆́𝒄𝒊𝒔𝒊𝒐𝒏 𝒇𝒂𝒊𝒕 𝒑𝒆𝒓𝒅𝒓𝒆 𝒅𝒖 𝒕𝒆𝒎𝒑𝒔, 𝒕𝒆𝒔𝒕𝒆𝒛 𝒍’𝒆𝒂𝒖 𝒆𝒕 𝒑𝒍𝒐𝒏𝒈𝒆𝒛 ! 𝑩𝒐𝒏𝒏𝒆 𝒐𝒖 𝑴𝒂𝒖𝒗𝒂𝒊𝒔𝒆 𝒅𝒆́𝒄𝒊𝒔𝒊𝒐𝒏, 𝒗𝒐𝒖𝒔 𝒍𝒆 𝒔𝒂𝒖𝒓𝒆𝒛 𝒃𝒊𝒆𝒏 𝒂𝒔𝒔𝒆𝒛 𝒕𝒐̂𝒕 𝒆𝒕 𝒗𝒐𝒖𝒔 𝒆𝒏 𝒓𝒆𝒕𝒊𝒆𝒏𝒅𝒓𝒆𝒛 𝒖𝒏𝒆 𝒍𝒆𝒄̧𝒐𝒏 𝒑𝒐𝒖𝒓 𝒍𝒆𝒔 𝒑𝒓𝒐𝒄𝒉𝒂𝒊𝒏𝒆𝒔 𝒆𝒙𝒑𝒆́𝒓𝒊𝒆𝒏𝒄𝒆𝒔. Et puis finalement ce qui peut paraître être une « mauvaise décision », vous en apprendra plus que vous ne le pensez ! Excellente semaine. #motivation #entrepreneurs #decision #actions  #failfast

Trois navires de pêche de 20 à 30 m de long, en provenance de Bretagne et du Pays Basque, sont arrivés ce week-end au Grand Port Maritime de Bordeaux, pour y être démantelés. Cinq unités les rejoignent aujourd’hui, et trois autres le 7 avril.L'arrivée de ces navires, pour près de 10 mois de chantier, illustre le savoir-faire reconnu des équipes du port pour l'accueil de ces activités, et les investissements soutenus de #BordeauxPort  pour la mise à niveau de ses installations : le GPMB est une référence en matière de #démantèlement de navires, puisqu’il est l’un des 18 sites mondiaux agréés par l’Union Européenne et le plus important en France.Ce chantier de déconstruction sera réalisé par la société PAPREC, groupe français spécialisé dans le #recyclage.Toutes les informations ici : https://lnkd.in/e-25k5gv

The surge in launch rates at the principal U.S. launch sites in Florida and California are drawing attention to the urgent need to accelerate transformation of these multi-user spaceports.  The forcing function is the rapidly decreasing cost to orbit.  This excellent graphic from visualcapitalist.com highlights the disruptive impact of SpaceX, a new player making more space applications feasible if not profitable.  I added two trend lines to make the change even more obvious.This trend is irreversible, new players will follow and build upon the SpaceX model or introduce new technologies which will make space access as routine as air is today.  Looking at this graphic it's not hard to believe the current forecasts of launch demand are conservative.

After 15 years as the founder and head of AMD Research, it is time for me to move on. Over the years, AMD Research has created a large number of new technologies for the good of AMD, the compute ecosystem, and humankind. My teams achieved amazing results through individual innovation, strong teamwork, and to quote Newton, by standing on the shoulders of giants. Thus, it is with great humility and immense thanks that I dedicate my departing post to all who came before, all my colleagues and friends at AMD, all our collaborators, and all those in the future who will continue to see over the horizon and push out the boundaries of knowledge. Most of all, I would like to thank the engineers and scientists at AMD Research for your creativity and hard work. Starting with 2.5 people and growing into the vibrant organization that exists today, we explored the art of the possible. Many more great things to come…#AMDResearch #AMD

Please join us tomorrow for a presentation about using deep learning to diagnosis breast cancer hosted by the AI Precision Health Institute  at the University of Hawai'i Cancer Center.This talk we be presented by Krzysztof Geras assistant professor at NYU Grossman School of Medicine of Medicine.Prof Geras' main interests are in unsupervised learning with neural networks, model compression, transfer learning, evaluation of machine learning models and applications of these techniques to medical imaging. In this talk he will describe his 7-year journey in developing deep learning methods for medical imaging, in particular, for breast cancer screening. He will also discuss the limitations and what can likely be achieved in the next few years.Please click the link below to register for the presentation on Zoom.#artificialintelligence  #deeplearning #technology John Shepherd
2d: Today, we're open-sourcing our animated drawings code + releasing a first-of-its-kind dataset of nearly 180,000 annotated amateur drawings to help researchers keep innovating in this space.More details on our blog ➡️ https://bit.ly/3zQwunIRead the paper ➡️ https://bit.ly/3Ut1B2gDrawing as a form of communication is often clear to other humans, but abstract appearances of amateur art can be challenging for AI models trained on real objects. With the new dataset we're releasing today, researchers and practitioners can build tools to more effectively analyze the contents of amateur drawings. We're excited for how this work will open new opportunities in storytelling, accessibility and more.

Bernard Canonne, un homme passionné et entrepreneur dans l'âme ✨Originaire d'Alsace, on peut dire que Bernard Canonne a vécu de nombreuses aventures professionnelles avant de poser ses yeux sur le Château Prieuré Marquet. Et ce fut ce que l'on appelle « un véritable coup de coeur » ! ❤️ Créer, développer et faire rayonner... Voilà ce qui anime le propriétaire du domaine !Patron de grandes surfaces, il est aussi le fondateur de Fontaineo, un concept de distribution gratuite d'eau fraiche dans l'espace public.En 2014, l’entrepreneur franc-comtois tombe sous le charme de Prieuré Marquet et décide de rendre ses lettres de noblesse à cette magnifique Chartreuse 🏰Avec respect et imagination, et soutenu par une équipe d'artisans exceptionnels, il souligne toute la dimension architecturale de la bâtisse, pour en faire aujourd'hui l'une des plus belles propriétés du vignoble bordelais 🍇#chateauprieuremarquet #chambredhotes #saintemilion #entrepreneur #wine #bordeaux #bordeauxmaville

Not long ago, breakthroughs in AI research often came from lone academics or small teams using desktop hardware. These days, not so much. Are you anxious about how to stay competitive in AI as an academic? Georgios N. Yannakakis and I wrote this paper for you, as practical advice, therapy session, and discussion starter:https://lnkd.in/efVCYH2hWe outline a number of different things you could do to stay competitive and do relevant, perhaps even important, AI research without having DeepMind-scale resources. It turns out there's actually a lot you can do, but you need to be ready to leave the mainstream and jump off the bandwagon. We also briefly discuss what industrial AI labs and universities can do to improve the situation.An HTML version of our paper can be found here:https://lnkd.in/eHr_X9H5

I’m very excited about extending large language models to access external sources of data. That would, in effect, realize the vision of flexible data integration systems. This short note points out a few lessons from data integration research that could help push this agenda forward.
6d: In this week's Artificially Intelligent Marketing, Martin Broadhurst FRSA takes us through some of the latest AI news for marketers. We also speak with Emil Lamprecht about a ninja AI application, where his team used GPT 3.5 to massively scale eCommerce product metadata and description updates across thousands of products, in a range of languages. Read more and listen here:https://lnkd.in/eJfwdN5e#marketing #ecommerce #ai
1d: I made a Linkedin comment using generative AI on a post about optimizing generative AI models by PyTorch. This is so meta!#chatgpt #EngageAI #generativeai

I'm super excited to share another update on how to optimize Transformer-based models and particularly generative AI models using PyTorch 2 with the publication of our most recent blog about optimizing Generative Diffusion models https://lnkd.in/g4v9qnss.Built from ground up for user experience and performance, PyTorch 2.0 offers out-of-the-box performance improvement for Generative Diffusion models by using the new torch.compile() compiler and Accelerated Transformers (formerly known as 'Better Transformer') with optimized implementations of Multihead Attention integrated with PyTorch 2!Find out more about accelerating Diffusion models in our PyTorch.org blog which you can find here =>https://lnkd.in/g4v9qnssI’m filled with gratitude for the privilege to work with some of the most amazing engineers in our industry at Meta.  A big shout out to the entire PyTorch team at large who builds the framework that enables leading edge research and production, and for building the AI community’s premier Transformer implementation. Particular kudos go to Grigory Sizov who did amazing work to optimize the diffusion models described here to take advantage of both the high-performance fused attention kernels, and take advantage of torch.compile() while he was still in new hire orientation.Download PyTorch 2 and explore how you can use PyTorch to build better and faster models for your application domains.  Then share how you are using PyTorch, torch.compile and Accelerated Transformers to create high quality models in the comments below.#PyTorch #PyTorch2 #PT2 #AI #GenerativeAI #AcceleratedTransformers #BetterTransformer #AcceleratedAI #accelerators #Meta #MetaAI
